abstract: Cooks cook. Hostesses host. Bartenders tend. What do owners do after a fine staff has been assembled and the handbooks have all been written?
snippet: Cooks cook. Hostesses host. Bartenders tend. What do owners do after a fine staff has been assembled and the handbooks have all been written?
lead_paragraph: I promised myself (and staff) (and wife) that I would dedicate every waking (and sleeping) hour to the operation of the restaurant for exactly one year. And then, crash tutorial completed, I would back off from the day-to-day obligations, trusting that the right staff had been marshaled and the right culture inculcated, that my personal stamp would not be erased without leaving some readable palimpsest. Detachment would be healthy for all concerned -- no one likes the boss hanging around all the time, and the boss could concentrate on neglected parts of his restaurant (and his life).

headline.main: Southfork Kitchen (and Its Owner) Have Survived a Year
